channel.title: Blogs on Brandon Liang
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Brandon Liang

item.title: The End of Sword Art Online
item.description:
The End of Sword Art Online

Today, November 7 at 14:55 JST, marks the day Kirito beat Sword Art Online (SAO)! For fans, today is more than just an anniversary; itâ€™s a reminder of why we fell in love with this world and its characters.

The Deeper Meaning

The Aincrad arc is the namesake of the show - players are trapped in a virtual reality MMORPG where if they die in the game, they die in real life.

item.title: New Grad Finale: 2023
item.description:
New Grad Finale: 2023

Read the 2022 prequel [here]

Northeastern has a co-op program where upperclassmen spend 4-8 months working full-time instead of taking classes for a semester. But I need to graduate and start working full-time eventually. How does it all end?

2023: running from the ax!

After months of being tested on algorithms, API design, culture fit, C++, debugging, distributed systems, full-stack web development, Linux, logic puzzles, network protocols, operating systems, probability, Python, SQL queries, and system design - it works out.

item.title: No Distractions
item.description:
Spotify No Longer Keeps Me Up

I always stay up way too late (even after getting work done) because I’m hooked on Spotify.

So I wrote a script and cron job to close Spotify automatically and scold me every night at 1:30 AM, 2:30 AM, and 3:30 AM!

Python

This is my computer systems knowledge coming to play! killall will send the SIGTERM signal to all Spotify processes running at the time, giving Spotify time to clean up so that essential operations can finish before shutting down.

item.title: Hackathons
item.description:
Last addition: January 2023

Before the pandemic, I went to a hackathon nearly once every other weekend. Hackathons were an opportunity to meet smart people at other universities, visit a new city, enjoy great food, and learn the hottest new technologies.

That lifestyle ended after I graduated, but this page is dedicated to those memories.

Also, here’s my Devpost.

Hack&Roll 2023 (Singapore)

VandyHacks IX (Nashville, TN)

item.title: << System Announcement >>
item.description: Welcome to my world. My name is Akihiko Kayaba. And as of this moment, I am in control of this world. I’m sure most of you have already noticed an item missing from your main menus: the logout button. Let me ensure you, this is not a defect in the game. I repeat… This is not a defect, this is how Sword Art Online was designed to be. You cannot log yourselves out of SAO. And no one from the outside will be able to shut down or remove the NerveGear from your head.

item.title: Projects
item.description:
Last addition: October 2022

See some of the best projects I’ve done as a student!

Transight

(Trans)action In(sight). This webapp helps people itemize their receipts for corporate reimbursements. A 3rd-party optical character recognition (OCR) API scans the uploaded receipt. [Demo]

AR Quiz

It's an augmented reality scavenger hunt. We made a quiz game in Unity where each question prompts you to find a QR in a specific room, which when scanned, renders a 3d object that answers the question (try this one ðŸ˜‰)! [Demo]

EAST

item.title: Returning to Yu-Gi-Oh
item.description:
Last modified on: 2022-08-22

I got back into Yu-Gi-Oh! recently with the iOS release of Master Duel and have built three different decks for competitive play. The highest tier I’ve made it to as of this writing is Platinum I (after Diamond rank update).

Swordsoul Tenyi

TODO

D/D/D

“D/D/D” stands for Different Dimension Daemon. Taste the power of demon kings that have conquered different dimensions.

It’s an incredibly hard deck to master, and I still am in the process of doing so. The central theme of the deck is utilizing every type of Extra Deck summoning method (Fusion, Xyz, Synchro, Link) to swarm the field with boss monsters. The “Dark Contract” Spells/Traps aid with searching and summoning these monsters, at a non-negligible cost of life points each turn. You should win fast or be prepared to counter this damage! [Deck Profile]

item.title: Co-op Duels: 2022
item.description:
Co-op Duels: 2022

Last modified on: 2023-01-21

Read the 2021 prequel [here]

Northeastern has a co-op program where upperclassmen spend 4-8 months working full-time instead of taking classes for a semester, here’s how it went during my junior year.

I interned as a software engineer at Snowflake in Boston working on diagnostics reporting, followed by Duolingo in Pittsburgh working on speech recognition, followed by Meta in NYC working on AR/VR headsets.

item.title: Thoughts
item.description:
My Thoughts

Just a collection of thoughts and interesting questions I’ve thought about. If you have answers or an opinion to these, I’d love to start a conversation!

Restart Civilization

Suppose every human on Earth suddenly disappears except you and the other people at your university or workplace. What is the first thing you and your friends do? In the long-term, how would this event affect race, religion, and politics?

item.title: Co-op Duels: 2021
item.description:
Co-op Duels: 2021

Last modified on: 2022-11-25

Northeastern has a co-op program where upperclassmen spend 4-8 months working full-time instead of taking classes for a semester, this is how it went during my sophomore year. Some people opt for one long co-op, some break it up into two (me), and some even three.

I interned as a software engineer at MathWorks working on the MATLAB engine, followed by Microsoft working on the Azure cloud computing platform, respectively.

item.title: My First Post!
item.description: I decided to migrate from my old website to a blog on the Hugo engine, since I feel like writing to capture my unconventional college experience. My university friend Josh also gave me some great advice to change to a minimalistic website as I’d get tired of the design less easily.
